title: Wolves close out Warriors for 2nd straight WCF
content: The Timberwolves are back in the Western Conference finals for the second straight year after closing out the Warriors with a 121-110 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Eagles-Chiefs rematch in W2 as NFL sked unveiled
content: A rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs will take place in Week 2 of the NFL season.

title: Johnson's Bears debut vs. Vikes opens MNF slate
content: The 2025 "Monday Night Football" schedule kicks off with an NFC North showdown between the Vikings and Bears on Sept. 8, when Ben Johnson makes his head coaching debut for Chicago.

title: Refocused Celtics lean on D, Kornet to stay alive
content: The Celtics used a reinvigorated defense and the unlikely breakout of backup big man Luke Kornet to keep their season alive and send this playoff series against the Knicks back to New York for Game 6 on Friday.

title: Kapanen's OT winner propels Oilers to West finals
content: Kasperi Kapanen scored on a scramble in front of the net at 7:14 of overtime, and the Edmonton Oilers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 1-0 in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the Western Conference finals for the second year in a row.

title: Reds celebrate Rose day after MLB reinstatement
content: Pete Rose was honored by the Reds on Wednesday night, a day after he was posthumously removed from MLB's permanent ineligibility list.

title: Sasaki unsure if velocity dip tied to shoulder issue
content: Roki Sasaki, who is on the injured list with a shoulder impingement, said he isn't sure if the injury is the main reason for an alarming dip in his fastball's velocity.

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video
content: Real Madrid defender Ra√∫l Asencio and three former teammates from the club's youth teams could face criminal charges for allegedly recording sexual images of a woman and a minor and distributing them without their consent.

title: Creativity shines as NFL teams unveil schedules
content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: The 49ers are back! Trouble for the Cowboys! Let's overreact to the NFL schedule reveal
content: Will the 49ers roll into the playoffs? Can the Giants, Lions and Cowboys overcome tough slates? Let's size up schedule reveal fallout.

title: Updated 2025 MLB draft rankings: Top 150 prospects -- and a mini-mock draft
content: The race for the No. 1 overall pick is wide open. Here's who your team could be targeting this summer.

title: How Alex Bregman is adjusting to life in a new clubhouse
content: The longtime face of the Astros is now tearing it up for the Red Sox -- while his future remains uncertain.

title: New NBA mock draft: We project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's our updated two-round mock.

content: Let's reason on why the Bears didn't improve at RB, why the Steelers didn't plan better at QB and why the Bengals didn't extend Trey Hendrickson (yet).

content: The 2024 WNBA rookies had a historic impact. What should we expect from the likes of Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark in Year 2?

content: The star forward recently completed surgery on his right Achilles tendon that was ruptured on Monday.

title: Jayson Tatum's injury timeline and what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: Following Tatum's devastating Achilles injury Monday, what has recovery looked like for other NBA stars?

title: How could the GOP tax bill affect sports teams?
content: A new tax plan that aims to curb breaks for team owners could lead to increased costs for fans, experts say.

title: 'It's everything I thought it would be': What's next for Rory McIlroy after long-awaited Masters win?
content: It's been just over a month since McIlroy's knees buckled under the weight of a dream finally achieved. He enters the PGA Championship as a distinct favorite, but he's still basking in his Masters title.

title: Tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the field.

title: Premier League Rookie of the Year: Ranking the best new U19 players
content: The Premier League Rookie of the Year award doesn't exist, but it should. Here are the young players who would be in the running for the 2024-25 prize.

title: Grading how every Big Ten men's basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: Rutgers' star duo fell short of expectations while Wisconsin's John Tonje helped the Badgers surpass theirs.

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Onside/Offside: Bar√ßa impress, Man United and Tottenham underwhelm
content: What teams showed the best and the worst of the 2024-25 European season? Luis Miguel Echegaray talks about all of that in his latest Onside/Offside column.

title: Sources: Man City eye Wirtz as Liverpool look on
content: Manchester City are pushing to sign Florian Wirtz but face stiff competition from Bayern Munich, a source has told ESPN.

title: NWSL players call for changes after King collapse
content: The NWSL Players Association said that play should have been stopped in the game between Angel City FC and the Utah Royals on Friday following the nearly 10-minute delay to provide medical attention to Savy King.

title: Bologna win Coppa Italia as Pulisic, Milan fall short
content: Dan Ndoye's second-half strike earned Bologna a hard-fought 1-0 victory over AC Milan in the Coppa Italia final on Wednesday to secure their first major trophy in 51 years.

title: Tottenham's Son files blackmail complaint in Seoul
content: Tottenham Hotspur captain Son Heung-min has filed a complaint to South Korean police alleging he was the victim of a blackmail attempt, his agency said on Thursday, after media reports that a woman had threatened him with a false pregnancy claim.

title: Tillman puts PSV on title brink as Ajax collapse
content: Ajax Amsterdam relinquished top spot in the Dutch league to PSV Eindhoven on the penultimate match day on Wednesday after they were held to a 2-2 draw following a late equaliser by Groningen.

title: Winless Galaxy squander lead, lose 10th of season
content: Tai Baribo scored two goals, including the game winner in the sixth minute of second-half stoppage time, as the Philadelphia Union rallied for a 3-2 victory Wednesday while keeping the Los Angeles Galaxy winless on the season.

title: MLS bans Rosales 3 games for discrimination
content: Minnesota United midfielder Joseph Rosales received a three-game ban from Major League Soccer after being found to have violated the MLS-MLSPA Joint Non-Discrimination Policy.

title: The UFC 317 and 319 title fights have big implications for the future
content: Pound-for-pound mainstays litter the main cards of UFC 317 and UFC 319, which means action is on the docket for sure.

title: Delhi HC seeks NIA's stand on Engineer Rashid's bail plea in terror funding case
content: The bench also asked the NIA to respond to a separate plea by Rashid challenging the framing of charges in the case.

title: Case in Madras High Court against song in actor Santhanam‚Äôs movie DD Next Level
content: The Madras High Court wants to know if the producers will be willing to delete or mute objectionable portion¬†

content: Iranian cheetahs face threats owing to a decline in primary prey species, habitat loss and fragmentation, human-wildlife conflict

content: Pakistan‚Äôs ‚Äòpolite‚Äô letter to India for restarting talks on the IWT doesn‚Äôt mention air strikes or India‚Äôs surprise release of Baglihar-Salal water

content: On¬†April 29, 2025, the Bombay High Court received a draft of the GR from the State government saying that it would be dealing with safe house for inter faith and inter caste couples, both married and unmarried.¬†¬†

content: He pointed out that of the 186 scheduled castes and sub-castes, many of the names were given by the upper castes

title: Kerala government initiates operation to capture ‚Äòman-eating‚Äô tiger in Malappuram
content: Government declares alert in the locality and intensifies patrolling by police and Forest department‚Äôs rapid response squads

content: The matter was mentioned for urgent listing before a bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justice Augustine George Masih

title: Lokayukta raid on seven government officials in Karnataka
content: They seized movable and immovable properties, which according to the officials were disproportionate to their known sources of income

title: More than decade after rape of minor, man sentenced to 10 years in jail in Maharashtra
content: Bablu alias Mohammad Mustapha Imtiyaz Shaikh who was 20 years old at the time of the crime was found guilty under relevant sections of the POCSO Act and for rape under the Indian Penal Code

title: Rumblings in Congress over KPCC rejig get louder with former president K. Sudhakaran expressing public displeasure
content: Sudhakaran says AICC had, at a stroke, attempted to remove him from Kerala politics by co-opting him as a permanent invitee to CWC, adding that he desired to remain as KPCC president

title: Trinamool Tehatta MLA Tapas Kumar Saha passes away at 66
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari expressed condolences over the demise of the sitting MLA

title: Kerala veteran CPI(M) leader G. Sudhakaran reveals ballot tampering in 1989 Lok Sabha polls
content: Sudhakaran says even ‚Äòif Election Commission is to initiate a case over the matter, it will not be a problem‚Äô

title: Five, including two children killed as bus catches fire in Lucknow
content: According to police, the private sleeper bus which was its way from Begusarai in Bihar to Delhi, caught fire due to a suspected short circuit.

title: 10 militants killed in Manipur near India-Myanmar border
content: ‚ÄòWhen it (the encounter with Manipur militants) gets over, we will be able to share details,‚Äô says Defence official

title: Supreme Court hearing LIVE: CJI Gavai-led Bench lists waqf case for further hearing on May 20
content: The top court will consider question of interim relief in pleas and also noted it will not consider any plea seeking stay of provisions of earlier 1995 Waqf law

title: Bengaluru HAL Airport reopening: Stakeholders meet, deliberate on modalities¬†¬†
content: Today, it takes almost two hours to even reach the gates of the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA), more than 40 km away from the city centre. The chaotic Hebbal interchange is in a mess, severely slowing down the airport approach by road

title: Judges‚Äô appointments not public recruitment, alive to shortage: Delhi HC
content: The plea sought urgent judicial intervention with respect to the ‚Äúalarming and chronic shortage‚Äù of judges in the high court,

title: Encounter breaks out in Pulwama‚Äôs Tral: Officials
content: Officials said the hiding terrorists opened fire on the security forces‚Äô search party, ‚Äútriggering an encounter‚Äù

title: Students‚Äô safety: MVD, police to put in place stringent norms for drivers
content: Only those who complete a one-day special training on safe driving by the Motor vehicles department will be allowed to operate educational institution vehicles in Kozhikode district

title: Good harvest in Uttarandhra districts brings down mango prices in Vizag
content: Season‚Äôs crop is not only plenty but also arrives all at once, leading to a drop in prices, says Estate Officer of a rythu bazaar

title: Nine held in TDP leader Veeraiah Chowdary‚Äôs murder case
content: Seven mobile phones and three knives were seized from their possession; three more accused persons are still absconding

title: BHEL urged to expedite equipment supply for Polavaram and Lower Sileru projects¬†
content: In a review meeting held Chief Secretary and Special Chief Secretary (Energy) K. Vijayanand requested BHEL to prioritise the completion of Polavaram and Lower Sileru projects.e

title: GHMC opens its doors to transgender persons, offers to employ them in various wings
content: The Urban Community Development wing seeks suggestions towards integration of the third gender into various roles in the civic body

title: Suspected spy held in Haryana's Panipat for sharing information with Pakistan
content: The suspect, Nauman Ilahi (24), is from Kairana in Uttar Pradesh, who had been working as a private security guard in the district, the police said on Wednesday (May 14, 2025).

title: 'Exercise restraint': SC slams minister for 'irresponsible' remarks on Col. Sofiya Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his "irresponsible" remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, emphasizing that individuals in constitutional roles must exercise caution, especially during sensitive operations like Operation Sindoor. Shah's comments, suggesting the Prime Minister sent a "terrorists' sister" to harm them, led to widespread condemnation and a High Court order for an FIR against him.

title: IPL: Why it makes sense to move the title clash from Kolkata to Ahmedabad
content: The BCCI is yet to confirm the venues for the IPL 2025 playoffs and final, with Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium emerging as a strong contender to host the title clash. While Kolkata's Eden Gardens was initially scheduled, weather concerns and the need to avoid further delays are influencing the decision.

title: Rahul Gandhi stopped by police from entering Ambedkar hostel in Bihar's Darbhanga
content: In Darbhanga, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi faced police obstruction while attempting to enter Ambedkar hostel for the ‚ÄòShiksha Nyay Samvad‚Äô with students. Local authorities denied entry, leading to protests from Bihar Congress leaders. The administration reportedly shifted the venue, but Congress insisted on the original location.

title: Microsoft's second biggest job cuts: Coders, managers, others asked to leave
content: Microsoft's recent layoffs disproportionately affected software engineers, with over 40% of Washington state cuts hitting coding professionals. Project management roles also saw significant impact as the company invests heavily in AI, which is automating aspects of software development.

title: Pak went running to try to achieve ceasefire like scared dog: Ex-Pentagon official
content: Michael Rubin stated that Pakistan hastily sought a ceasefire after India effectively countered its missile and drone attacks. He highlighted India's precise strikes on terror infrastructure within Pakistan and PoK, which successfully neutralized Pakistan's retaliatory efforts. Rubin emphasized that India's diplomatic victory lies in shifting global focus onto Pakistan's support for terrorism, exposing the deep ties between the Pakistani military and terrorist organizations.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs scenarios explained: Who needs to do what to qualify
content: Following a brief interruption, the IPL is set to resume on May 17, with Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants vying for the final playoff spot. MI and DC are in a strong position, while KKR and LSG face an uphill battle. Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from contention.

title: Muslim man allowed to have multiple wives if he can treat them equally: Allahabad HC
content: The Allahabad High Court has stated that Muslim men can marry more than once if they treat all wives equally, referencing Quranic permission for polygamy under specific conditions. This ruling came during a case involving Furkan, accused of bigamy and rape for marrying without disclosing his existing wife. The court dismissed the charges, acknowledging Muslim law allows multiple wives, and ordered further investigation while protecting Furkan from coercive action.

title: Tesla VP Ashok Elluswamy says Elon Musk ‚Äòcan predict the future‚Äô
content: Ashok Elluswamy, Tesla's VP of AI Software, revealed insights into working with Elon Musk, highlighting his intelligence, work ethic, risk-taking attitude, and sense of humor. Elluswamy, who meets with Musk weekly, shared these observations in a podcast, emphasizing Musk's ability to foresee future trends and his dedication to working long hours.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices down Rs 7,900 per 10 grams from record highs
content: Gold rate today: Gold and silver prices faced a decline in the Multi Commodity Exchange. Safe haven demand decreased due to US-China trade discussions. Experts suggest precious metal prices will remain volatile.

title: 'We've lost trust in men': Deceived by husbands, 2 UP women ‚Äòmarry‚Äô each other
content: In Bareilly, two women, Asha (Golu) and Jyoti, both deceived about their husbands' religious identities, have forged an unconventional bond. Estranged from family and societal norms, they found solace in shared experiences and decided to "marry" in a temple ceremony.

title: 'I need ...': Prithvi Shaw shares cryptic post ahead of IPL resumption
content: Prithvi Shaw's recent social media activity has stirred discussions. He posted a cryptic message before the Indian Premier League resumes. Shaw's career has faced challenges with form and fitness. He was dropped from Mumbai's team and went unsold in the IPL auction. Shashank Singh suggested Shaw improve his lifestyle. The message raises questions about Shaw's next steps.

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: ‚ÄòSpeak in Marathi or we won‚Äôt pay‚Äô: Quarrel over pizza delivery turns into language row
content: A pizza delivery dispute occurred in Bhandup. It involved Vaidehi Pathak and delivery boy Rohit Lavera. The argument started over pizza quality. It then shifted to the use of Marathi language. Pathak insisted Lavera speak Marathi. Lavera, a native of Haryana, refused. MNS intervened, and Lavera apologized. Police have registered a non-cognisable offence and are investigating the matter.

title: Bangladesh to get $1.3bn from IMF; seeks $762m augmentation in support
content: Bangladesh has requested an additional $762 million from the IMF, potentially increasing total assistance to $4.1 billion. This request comes as the nation faces macroeconomic challenges, including slowed GDP growth and persistent inflation. The IMF's support is contingent upon Bangladesh undertaking critical reforms, such as exchange rate liberalization and tax improvements, to ensure financial stability.

title: ‚ÄòRs 9 l Rolex, Bottega wallet, diamond rings‚Äô: Cabbie steals valuables from dancer's car
content: Bengaluru police apprehended Mohammed Mastan for stealing valuables from a dancer's car. The incident occurred on Queens Road when the dancer parked her car and went to Cubbon Park. Mastan noticed the unsecured boot and seized the opportunity. The stolen items, including a Rolex watch and diamond rings, have been recovered.

title: With ‚Äòspecial troops train‚Äô, govt signals J&K plan‚Äôs on track
content: Indian Railways successfully conducted a trial run of a special train on the Katra-Qazigund section. This section includes the Chenab Bridge. The train carried soldiers and completed a round trip with full security. This trial is significant due to the ongoing Indo-Pak conflict. The new rail line will improve connectivity to Kashmir.

title: Fire breaks out at Sri Guru Gobind Singh College of Commerce in Delhi
content: A fire broke out on Thursday morning at Sri Guru Gobind Singh College of Commerce in Delhi's Pitampura. The blaze, which started in the library, was brought under control around 9:40 am after 11 fire tenders were deployed. No casualties were reported.

title: ‚ÄòMain bol raha hoon‚Äô: BSF jawan's first call home melts wife‚Äôs heart
content: BSF Jawan Purnam Shaw returned to India after 22 days in Pakistan custody, bringing immense relief to his family in Kolkata. His wife, Rajni, confirmed his identity through a phone call and shared the news with their son. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee assured Rajni of Purnam's well-being and expressed her desire to meet him upon his return.

title: Genelia Deshmukh says working with Aamir Khan in ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô feels ‚Äòspecial‚Äô
content: Genelia Deshmukh is making a comeback with Aamir Khan in 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She describes the role as special. Aamir plays a basketball coach training intellectually disabled children. The film explores themes of growth and acceptance. It features ten new young actors. Aamir Khan returns to acting after a break. The movie is set to release on June 20.

title: After Musk‚Äôs Starlink, Amazon eyes India's satellite internet space
content: Amazon's Project Kuiper, under Jeff Bezos, is vying for entry into India's satellite internet market, seeking DoT approval amidst competition from Bharti-backed Eutelsat OneWeb and Reliance Jio-SES JV. Kuiper plans a substantial infrastructure with ten gateways and two presence points, aiming for commercial launch later this year after recent satellite launches.

title: England cricketer trolls Babar Azam over contrasting PSL records
content: Sam Billings ignited a playful rivalry with Babar Azam by sharing a post highlighting their contrasting PSL 2025 records. Billings celebrated his blistering 19-ball fifty, the fastest this season, while subtly mocking Babar's slow 47-ball half-century. As the PSL 2025 is set to resume on May 17, all eyes are on how both players respond on the field.

title: Stock market: Nifty50, Sensex volatile in trade, swing between green and red
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started trade on a choppy note on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 24,650, BSE Sensex was below 81,300.

title: 'Why, Virat? We all still need you!': Tharoor pays glowing tribute to Kohli
content: Shashi Tharoor expressed his sadness over Virat Kohli's unexpected retirement from Test cricket, calling him "immortal in whites." Tharoor reminisced about their meeting and admired Kohli's Test performances, lamenting the absence of a farewell match. Kohli's exit at 36 marks the end of an era, leaving a void as India prepares for the next World Test Championship cycle.

title: ‚ÄòGutter language‚Äô: HC slams BJP minister, orders FIR for remark against Col Qureshi
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has taken suo motu cognizance of state minister Vijay Shah's derogatory remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, ordering the DGP to file an FIR. The court condemned Shah's ‚Äúgutter language‚Äù as disparaging to both the officer and the armed forces.

title: 10 militants killed in gunfight with Assam Rifles in Manipur's Chandel
content: The Army's Eastern Command said in a post on X, "Acting on specific intelligence on movement of armed cadres nearby New Samtal village, Khengjoy Tehsil, Chandel District near the Indo-Myanmar Border, Assam Rifles unit under Spear Corps launched an operation on 14 May 2025."

title: Gold price prediction: Why is Rs 92,000 level critical?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold prices have sharply declined, reaching a critical support level of ‚Çπ92,000, a break below which could trigger further selling. Conversely, silver exhibits strength, consolidating between ‚Çπ95,300 and ‚Çπ97,500.

title: To return or not: Foreign players face dilemma ahead of IPL resumption
content: IPL franchises face disruption as international cricket schedules clash with the league's resumption. South Africa's directive to recall players for the WTC final by May 26th creates challenges, impacting teams like Gujarat Titans and Punjab Kings. England's ODI series against West Indies further complicates matters, potentially affecting teams like Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Sky-high valour: Bihar‚Äôs sons at helm of Operation Sindoor
content: Air Marshal Awadesh Kumar Bharti, hailing from Purnia, Bihar, played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor as the DG Air Operations, avenging the Pahalgam killings. Inspired by the establishment of a military airbase in his town after the 1962 war, he excelled in Sainik School and NDA, earning prestigious awards for his service.

title: India meets UN counter-terror officials, pushes for listing of LeT front TRF
content: An Indian delegation met with UN officials to bolster counter-terrorism cooperation following the Pahalgam attack claimed by a Lashkar-e-Taiba front. Discussions revisited commitments from the 2022 Delhi Declaration and addressed threats from unmanned aerial systems and terrorist financing. The meeting occurred amidst heightened tensions and military actions between India and Pakistan after the attack.

title: Festival de Cannes: How to pronounce 'Cannes' correctly
content: As the Cannes Film Festival attracts global attention, mastering the pronunciation of 'Cannes' as 'Kan' is crucial for fashion enthusiasts and film lovers. Correct pronunciation demonstrates cultural awareness and enhances one's presence in elite circles. Mispronouncing it can lead to social faux pas, especially in fashion-conscious environments.

title: 5, including 2 kids, charred to death as double-decker bus catches fire in Lucknow
content: A tragic fire on a Lucknow flyover claimed five lives, including two children, when a private bus carrying 80 passengers caught fire. The bus, en route from Bihar to Delhi, experienced flames erupting for unknown reasons. The driver and conductor reportedly fled, leaving passengers trapped. Rescue operations were launched, and the deceased have been identified as residents of Begusarai, Bihar.

title: Kerala LSS USS scholarship result 2025 declared; download here
content: The Kerala Pareeksha Bhavan has declared the LSS and USS Scholarship Exam Results 2025 on May 14, 2025. Students can check their results at bpekerala.in using their registration number and date of birth. The LSS cut-off is 48 marks, and the USS cut-off is 63 marks. Qualified students must submit verification documents by June 15, 2025. Re-evaluation applications are open until May 31, 2025. The scholarships support academically talented students from Classes 4 and 7.

title: 'Virat Kohli put his heart and soul into Test cricket'
content: Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket has drawn widespread acclaim, with legends like Atherton and Hussain lauding his transformative impact. Kohli ended his career with 9,230 runs in 123 Tests. Atherton admired Kohli's passion, while Hussain highlighted his aura and leadership. Kohli's captaincy saw India become the No. 1 Test side for 42 months, marking a fearless era.

title: Can SC fix deadlines for President, governors‚Äô assent to bills?: Murmu
content: President Murmu has sought the Supreme Court's opinion on the validity of its recent verdict that set deadlines for governors and the President to decide on state bills. Questioning the constitutional basis for such timelines, she invoked Article 143(1) to address concerns about the court's overreach and the concept of deemed assent, deeming it alien to the constitutional framework.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha suggests a positive outlook for Nifty and Bank Nifty, setting targets at 24900/25400 and a range of 54500-55900, respectively. Havells, Adani Energy Solutions, and HCL Technologies are top buy recommendations.

title: IAEA says no report of radiation leak from any Pak facility
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has refuted claims of a radiation leak from any Pakistani nuclear facility, following reports that Indian missiles struck Kirana Hills during Operation Sindoor. This clarification counters widespread social media speculation and foreign media theories. The IAEA confirmed that, based on available information, no radiation release occurred.

title: Pakistan's appeal to India: Rethink suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan has appealed to India to reconsider its decision to keep the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, citing the dependence of millions on the regulated water. India, however, remains firm on its decision, taken in response to terrorist activities, asserting that changed circumstances and Pakistan's actions warrant a reevaluation of the treaty.

title: When Aishwarya broke the internet with purple lipstick at Cannes Film Festival
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes Film Festival appearances are always a highlight, especially her bold fashion choices. In 2016, her purple lipstick became a viral sensation, sparking both praise and criticism. Amitabh Bachchan defended her look, emphasizing social media's role in self-expression and the fleeting nature of trends. Now, as Cannes 2025 begins, fans eagerly anticipate Aishwarya's next iconic moment.

title: Pak inked deal with crypto company in which Trump kin has 60% stake
content: Donald Trump's renewed interest in mediating between India and Pakistan coincides with a recent deal between Pakistan's Crypto Council and World Liberty Financial (WLF), a cryptocurrency venture with Trump family ties. This partnership, involving figures like Zachary Witkoff, raises questions about potential connections between the crypto deal and Trump's shift in stance on the Indo-Pak conflict.

title: Ax-4, with India‚Äôs Shubhanshu Shukla, to liftoff on June 8
content: Axiom Space's Ax-4 mission, piloted by India‚Äôs Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the ISS on June 8. The mission, carried by a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, will include astronauts from India, Poland, and Hungary, marking a return to human spaceflight for each nation after over four decades.

title: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak‚Äôs Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Overseas borrowing surges to 5-year high
content: India's private sector is witnessing a surge in investment, with companies securing a record $11 billion in external commercial borrowings (ECBs) in March 2025. This five-year high, driven by confidence in India's economic prospects, saw approvals granted to firms like Foxconn's Yuzhan Technology and JSW Steel. For FY25, total ECB proposals reached $61.

title: ‚ÄòRaid 2‚Äô collection: Ajay Devgn‚Äôs crime drama mints over Rs 174 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' performs well at the box office. The crime drama inches closer to beating Salman Khan‚Äôs 'Sikandar' globally. The film earns Rs 133.45 crore in India. Overseas collections reach Rs 19.60 crore. The worldwide total stands at Rs 174.25 crore. 'Raid 2' aims to enter the Rs 150 crore club in India soon.

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh In Srinagar, Meets Army Troops
content: Earlier this week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Punjab's Adampur air base and interacted with soldiers.

title: "Putting You On Guard": Court Raps Telangana Over Hyderabad Deforestation Row
content: The Supreme Court directed the government of Telangana to take steps to restore the forest area in Hyderabad's Kancha Gachibowli, which has seen protests by students and environmental activists over tree-felling.

title: "Instructed By Creators" To Speak About 'White Genocide' In South Africa: Grok
content: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok is under scrutiny for repeatedly referencing the "white genocide" in South Africa - a right-wing conspiracy theory - even in responses to unrelated queries.

title: 5 Killed, Including 2 Children As Moving Bus Catches Fire In Lucknow
content: Five passengers, including two children, were killed when a private bus caught fire in the Mohanlalganj area here early Thursday, police said.

title: "When Tharoor Saab Speaks...": Congress Sends A "Lakshman Rekha" Message
